intro: Rothia degenerica, commonly known as the degenerate rothia, is a rare and lesser-known plant species with unique botanical characteristics. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pale green leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in temperate regions. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Rothia degenerica is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
